alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains; Eddy Plains; Lea; Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 29 at 1:09PM MDT until March 29 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM CDT /10 AM MDT/ TO 10 PM CDT /9 PM MDT/ TODAY FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY LESS THAN 10 PERCENT, 20FT WINDS OF 25 MPH OR MORE, AND EXTREME FIRE DANGER FOR ALL OF WEST TEXAS AND SOUTHEAST MEXICO... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT /9 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY LESS THAN 10 PERCENT, 20FT WINDS OF 25 MPH OR MORE, AND EXTREME FIRE DANGER FOR ALL OF WEST TEXAS AND SOUTHEAST MEXICO... * AFFECTED AREA...All of southeast New Mexico and the Permian Basin. * TIMING...Until 10 PM CDT/9 PM MDT this evening. * WINDS...Plains, southwest 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 55 mph. Mountains, west 40 to 60 mph with gusts to 75 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 7 percent. * RFTI...6 or critical to 7 or extreme.
info.instruction: Do not throw cigarettes onto the ground or out of a moving vehicle. Keep vehicles on driving surfaces and do not drive through tall grass. Stow chains properly. Today is considered to be a potentially dangerous weather and fuels situation. Strong winds and low relative humidities combined with recent ongoing drought will result in high significant fire potential.

area.areaDesc: Chaves County Plains; Eddy Plains; Lea; Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains
